member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogRegionModeConstants
member.summary: Enumeration of Region modes. Region mode specifies how a region is applied to an image.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogRegionModeConstants.PixelAlignedBoundingBoxAdjustMask
member.summary: Only the pixels within the supplied region are used. This is implemented by computing a mask which extends the region to its pixel aligned bounding box.

remarks.PARA: If you specify an input region other than a simple, pixel-aligned rectangle, this region mode specifies that all the pixels within a pixel-aligned bounding box that encloses the region will be supplied to the vision tool. Those pixels that lie inside the bounding box but outside the region that you supply are set as "don't care" pixels in the mask image used by the vision tool (if it supports one). The following figure shows the effect of using this mode if you specify an ellipse as an input region.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogRegionModeConstants.PixelAlignedBoundingBox
member.summary: The region used will be the pixel aligned bounding box enclosing the supplied region. This mode often provides faster performance than the PixelAlignedBoundingBoxAdjustMask mode.

remarks.PARA: If you specify an input region other than a simple, pixel-aligned rectangle, this region mode specifies that all the pixels within a pixel-aligned bounding box that encloses the region will be supplied to the vision tool. The following figure shows the effect of using this mode if you specify an ellipse as an input region.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogRegionModeConstants.AffineTransform
member.summary: A new image will be created by performing an affine transformation on the region. The region must be either a simple rectangle or an affine rectangle.

remarks.PARA: If you specify an as your input region, you can specify this region mode to have VisionPro affine-transform the pixels in the region into a new, pixel-aligned rectangular image.
This mode is appropriate when your vision tool requires a pixel-aligned rectangular input region, but the data you wish to supply lies at an angle in the input image.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogRunStatus
member.summary: This interface is returned by the RunStatus property of the ICogTool interface and provides general information about the last call to the tool's Run method. Note that serious errors that occur within the tool's Run method may only be detected by examining the RunStatus after calling Run. It is the user's responsibility to examine the tool's RunStatus after calling Run.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogRunStatus.Result
member.summary: Gets a result code that indicates the overall result of running the tool.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogRunStatus.Message
member.summary: Returns null if the result was Accept, and otherwise returns a string that provides additional information about the Warning, Reject or Error condition.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogRunStatus.ProcessingTime
member.summary: Returns the time in miliseconds taken to perform the tool's processing when its Run function was called. This excludes the time taken by event handlers connected to the tool.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogRunStatus.TotalTime
member.summary: Returns the total time in milliseconds taken by the tool's Run function. This includes the time taken by event handlers connected to the tool.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogRunStatus.Exception
member.summary: Returns the exception that happened when the tool's Run method was called, or null if no exception happened.

member.summary: This interface is implemented by all VisionPro tools.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogChangedEvent
member.summary: This interface contains the Changed event and methods for suspending and resuming it.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogChangedEvent.SuspendChangedEvent
member.summary: Temporarily suspends the raising of the Changed event. May be called more than once, and a corresponding call to ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent must be made for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogChangedEvent.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called, and raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.
member.exception: If the ChangedEventSuspended count is currently zero.
member.event: Fires if the ChangedEventSuspended count is decremented to zero and a Changed event had been suppressed one or more times while changed events were suspended.

member.name: E:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogChangedEvent.Changed
member.summary: This event is raised when one or more parts of the object's state may have changed.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogChangedEvent.ChangedEventSuspended
member.summary: Indicates if the raising of the Changed event has been suspended.
member.value: If nonzero, indicates that the raising of the Changed event has been suspended. This value is incremented when SuspendChangedEvent is called and decremented when ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent is called.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogTool.Run
member.summary: Runs the tool. This method is guaranteed to not throw an exception. Any exception generated in the course of running the tool will be caught and packaged in the tool's RunStatus.Exception. Should this occur, the tool's RunStatus.Result will be set to Error and its RunStatus.Message will reference the message that accompanied the exception. It is the user's responsibility to examine the tool's RunStatus after calling Run.

example.code:
Imports Cognex.VisionPro
Private Function RunTool() As Boolean mTool.Run() ' a previously created and configured tool ...
Dim aRunStatus As Cognex.VisionPro.ICogRunStatus = mTool.RunStatus
If (aRunStatus.Result = CogToolResultConstants.Error) Then If (Not aRunStatus.Exception Is Nothing) Then MessageBox.Show("Exception: " + _ aRunStatus.Exception.ToString()) End If
If (Not aRunStatus.Message Is Nothing) Then MessageBox.Show("Message: " + _ aRunStatus.Message) End If
RunTool = False Else RunTool = True End If
End Function

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogRunStatus
member.summary: This class provides an implementation of the ICogRunStatus interface. A tool's RunStatus property is of type CogRunStatus. This property provides general information about the last call to the tool's Run method. Note that serious errors that occur within the tool's Run method may only be detected by examining the RunStatus after calling Run. It is the user's responsibility to examine the tool's RunStatus after calling Run.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogToolBase.Run
member.summary: Runs the tool. This method is guaranteed to not throw an exception. Any exception generated in the course of running the tool will be caught and packaged in the tool's RunStatus.Exception. Should this occur, the tool's RunStatus.Result will be set to Error and its RunStatus.Message will reference the message that accompanied the exception. It is the user's responsibility to examine the tool's RunStatus after calling Run.

example.code:
Imports Cognex.VisionPro
Private Function RunTool() As Boolean mTool.Run() ' a previously created and configured tool ...
Dim aRunStatus As Cognex.VisionPro.ICogRunStatus = mTool.RunStatus
If (aRunStatus.Result = CogToolResultConstants.Error) Then If (Not aRunStatus.Exception Is Nothing) Then MessageBox.Show("Exception: " + _ aRunStatus.Exception.ToString()) End If
If (Not aRunStatus.Message Is Nothing) Then MessageBox.Show("Message: " + _ aRunStatus.Message) End If
RunTool = False Else RunTool = True End If
End Function

member.summary: Class used to synchronize access to VisionPro members. Multithreaded applications must provide an instance of this class to any edit controls sharing tools the application will be accessing from a non-GUI thread. It is the responsibility of the application to lock and unlock the CogSyncObject whenever it is accessing the tool.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogTypeResolveUtils
member.summary:
Custom VisionPro class for resolving string based .NET type information. Tries to mimic .NET's behavior (i.e. Type.GetType()) except to: 1. Override strong name version binding for VisionPro assemblies (use the newest version available). 2. Override strong name version binding for customer assemblies with the CogSerializationBinderAttribute.UseLatestVersionBinder set to true. (use the newest version available). 3. Override strong name version binding for assemblies that use the CogSerializationBinderAttribute.CustomBinder (by calling the custom binder). 4. Enable Resolving of VisionPro types using type string information that was specified without (or with partial) assembly information, especially if this type is not already loaded in the app domain (by searching the VisionPro assembly metadata).
CogTypeResolveUtils exists because VisionPro updates the strong name version numbers of its assemblies for every release yet still wants VisionPro types from assemblies with earlier version #'s (usually in vpp files) to be bound or resolved to their equivilent types in newer versions of the VisionPro assemblies.
This requires overiding the normal .NET strong name binding conventions with a custom scheme (described above).
Most (all?) of this code would not be necessary if VisionPro only updated its assembly version numbers for truly incomaptible (breaking) changes to an assembly.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogTypeResolveUtils.ResolveType(System.String)
member.summary: Resolve the type name infomration contained in typeName using VisionPro's custom type resolving scheme.
member.param: The assembly-qualified name of the type to get. If the type is a VisionPro type it is sufficient to supply the type name qualified by its namespace.
member.returns: The resolved type.
member.remarks:
For Cognex Internal Use Only!
For VisionPro types (and third party types whose assemblies have the CogSerializationBinderAttribute.UseLatestVersionBinder set to true) this function will ignore any strong name version infomation and return Types bound to the latest (highest assembly version number) Assembly found in the GAC.
member.exception: Throws TypeLoadException().

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogTypeResolveUtils.RemoveVersion(System.String)
member.summary: Strips the version information from an AQN or a type FullName. For example, "Cognex.VisionPro.Blob.CogBlob, Cognex.VisionPro.Blob, Version=43.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=ef0f902af9dee505" becomes "Cognex.VisionPro.Blob.CogBlob, Cognex.VisionPro.Blob, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=ef0f902af9dee505"
member.param: The type spec from which to remove the version info.
member.returns: The type spec with the version info removed.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogTypeResolveUtils.RemoveCulture(System.String)
member.summary: Strips the culture information from an AQN or a type FullName. For example, "Cognex.VisionPro.Blob.CogBlob, Cognex.VisionPro.Blob, Version=43.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=ef0f902af9dee505" becomes "Cognex.VisionPro.Blob.CogBlob, Cognex.VisionPro.Blob, Version=43.0.0.0, PublicKeyToken=ef0f902af9dee505"
member.param: The type spec from which to remove the culture info.
member.returns: The type spec with the culture info removed.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogTypeResolveUtils.RemovePublicKey(System.String)
member.summary: Strips the public key information from an AQN or a type FullName. For example, "Cognex.VisionPro.Blob.CogBlob, Cognex.VisionPro.Blob, Version=43.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=ef0f902af9dee505" becomes "Cognex.VisionPro.Blob.CogBlob, Cognex.VisionPro.Blob, Version=43.0.0.0, Culture=neutral"
member.param: The type spec from which to remove the public key info.
member.returns: The type spec with the public key info removed.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogTypeResolveUtils.RemoveStrongNameDetails(System.String)
member.summary: Strips all strong name details from an AQN or a type FullName. For example, "Cognex.VisionPro.Blob.CogBlob, Cognex.VisionPro.Blob, Version=43.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=ef0f902af9dee505" becomes "Cognex.VisionPro.Blob.CogBlob, Cognex.VisionPro.Blob"

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogSerializationBinder
member.summary:
This class provides for the VisionPro binding behavior.
If the latest version of the given assembly has the attribute "CogSerializationBinderAttribute", then this attribute is used to select a binder for that assembly.
Otherwise, assembly version independence is provided to Cognex.* types automatically (Cognex types referred to in archives will be automatically upgraded to the latest installed assembly version).

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogCollectionBase
member.summary: Base class for a generic ordered collection of values that raises events whenever any change is made.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogChangedEventBase
member.summary:
A base class that implements the
interface. Objects that derive from this class will raise the Changed event whenever part of the object's state has changed.
member.remarks: Classes can most easily implement the ICogChangedEvent interface by deriving from this class. However in some cases a class may need to derive from some other base class, so the actual implementation of the ICogChangedEvent behavior is provided by the class that can be used by delegation rather than by inheritance.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogChangedEventBase.SfNextSf
member.summary: The next state flag value to be used by a derived class.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogChangedEventBase.SuspendChangedEvent
member.summary: Temporarily suspends the raising of the Changed event. May be called more than once, and a corresponding call to ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent must be made for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogChangedEventBase.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called, and raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.
member.exception: If the ChangedEventSuspended count is currently zero.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogChangedEventBase.OnChanged(System.Int64)
member.summary: This method should be called internally whenever the object's state may have changed.
member.param: The set of state flags that correspond to the parts of the object that may have changed.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogChangedEventBase.OnChanged(Cognex.VisionPro.CogChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: This method may be called internally whenever a derived object's state may have changed and the derived object expresses this change via a derived CogChangedEventArgs class.
member.param: EventArgs to be fired with the change event.

member.name: E:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogChangedEventBase.Changed
member.summary: This event is raised when one or more parts of the object's state may have changed.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogChangedEventBase.ChangedEventSuspended
member.summary: If nonzero, indicates that the raising of the Changed event has been suspended. This value is incremented when SuspendChangedEvent is called and decremented when ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent is called.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogTrackedItemBase.Value
member.summary: Gets or Sets the value of the terminal.
member.remarks: The terminal value property provides storage for arbitrary link data.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogTrackedItemBase.Name
member.summary: Gets or Sets the name of the terminal.
member.remarks: The terminal name is used to index a CogToolTerminalsCollection and also provide the name for the graphical representation of this terminal.
member.exception: Thrown if the "Name" is not a valid .NET variable name or if "Name" is not unique in within a ToolBlock terminal collection of which this terminal is a member.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogTrackedItemBase.ID
member.summary: Gets the ID property of the terminal
member.remarks:
The terminal ID holds a GUID string which identifies a particular terminal object instance. A new GUID is created and assinged to the ID property when a terminal is created using the (name, value) or (name, valueType) constructor. The ID property is serialized. The ID property is cloned. The ID property is used to index CogToolTerminalsCollection.
Indexing by ID provides a path for termianl links (or CogDataBindings) to CogToolBlock Inputs and Outputs.
Serializing or cloning a terminal will result in a terminal with the same ID as the oringinal terminal. This is desireable so that links (a.k.a. DataBindings) that use the ID property in their paths maitiain their links when copied or serialized.
This means that it is possilble to create multiple terminals with the same ID property. However, the ID field will always be unique amongst terminals within a CogToolBlockTerminalCollection.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogTrackedItemBase.ValueType
member.summary: Gets the expected value type of the terminal
member.remarks: The terminal value type controls the linking behavior. Terminals can only be linked if their value types are compatible. See line 1631 of CogToolNode.cs for a better understanding of what it means for types to be compatible... Roughly, if the destination type is "assignable" from the source type or the destination can be "converted" (using .NET) to the source type the types are compatible.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogParseGenericAQN
member.summary:
This class parses a .NET Assembly Qualified Name (AQN). Though it should handle any properly formatted AQN, it is designed specifically to handle the parseing of AQN which contains generic type information.
This class was created for use by the VisionPro serialization mechanism to enable deserialization of generic types that is consistent with normal VisionPro deserialization (Serialized VisionPro objects often wish to bind to the latest version of an assembly available on deserialization).
member.remarks:
Most of the information need to construct this parser was taken from here: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/w3f99sx1.aspx and here: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/yfsftwz6(VS.80).aspx
here are some AQN examples:
A generic type with one type argument "MyGenericType`1[MyType]" A generic type with two type arguments "MyGenericType`2[MyType,AnotherType]" A generic type with two assembly-qualified type arguments "MyGenericType`2[[MyType,MyAssembly],[AnotherType,AnotherAssembly]]" An assembly-qualified generic type with an assembly-qualified type argument "MyGenericType`1[[MyType,MyAssembly]],MyGenericTypeAssembly" A generic type whose type argument is a generic type with two type arguments "MyGenericType`1[AnotherGenericType`2[MyType,AnotherType]]"

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogParseGenericAQN.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new CogParseGenericAQN
member.param: The AQN to parse

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogParseGenericAQN.ParseAQN(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the given AQN into its pieces
member.param: the AQN to parse

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogParseGenericAQN.GetAssemblyName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the Assembly name from an AQN
member.param: the AQN from which to retreive the Assembly Name
member.returns: the Assembly Name

member.summary: Returns the Type Name part of an AQN
member.param: the AQN from which to retireve the type name
member.returns: the Type Name

member.summary: This class is intended to be used in cases where paired calls to ChangedEventSuspended and ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent are needed. Class users will instantiate the class in a C# using statement. The constructor will automatically call ChangedEventSuspended; Dispose will call ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent. If Dispose hasn't been called, the finalizer (i.e. destructor) will automatically call it.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogToolTerminals.CogInvalidCastContants
member.summary:
This enum is used by members of CogToolTerminals to switch between different behaviors regarding how paths which contain invalid casts are handled.
Most times (like when we are parsing paths or evaluating links) we wish to follow the path as though the cast had succedded, even if it didn't. Other times. like when we are trying to get the value of the terminal we want to ignore the actual cast and pretend as though the cast was to the type of which the object actually is.
I think this goes back to the original databinding philosophy that started with Jay. In a nutshell I think this philosophy says "we will try anything we can to make a binding to an existing path succeed."

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAddSpaceConstants
member.summary: In a coordinate space tree each child of a given parent space must have a unique name. This enumeration specifies what action will be taken when the user attempts to add a duplicate child space name to an existing parent in the tree.

remarks.para:
In a
or each child of a given parent space must have a unique name. This enumeration specifies what action to take if you try to add a coordinate space to a parent space that already has an immediate child with the same name as the one you are trying to add. The options are to return an error, replace the named item, or do nothing.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAddSpaceConstants.DuplicateIsError
member.summary: Attempts to add a duplicate child space will fail. An error will be returned.

remarks.para: Attempts to add a duplicate child space will fail, and an error will be returned.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAddSpaceConstants.ReplaceDuplicate
member.summary: Attempts to add a duplicate child space will, instead, replace the transform of the existing child with the same name. Attempts to add a duplicate child tree will replace the entire subtree of the existing child, as well as its transform.

remarks.para: Attempts to add a duplicate child space will, instead, replace the transform of the existing child with the same name. Attempts to add a duplicate child tree will replace the entire subtree of the existing child, as well as its transform.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAddSpaceConstants.IgnoreDuplicate
member.summary: Attempts to add a duplicate child space will be ignored. No error will be returned.

remarks.para: Attempts to add a duplicate child space will be ignored. No error will be returned.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogSpaceTreePathnameConstants
member.summary: This enumeration controls the formatting of coordinate space names that are returned from a coordinate space tree ( or ).

remarks.para: This enumeration controls the formatting of coordinate space names that are returned from a coordinate space tree ( or ).

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogSpaceTreePathnameConstants.None

remarks.para: Express space names as a single, nonqualified name.

member.summary: Returned space names will be expressed as a single, non-qualified name.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogSpaceTreePathnameConstants.Full
member.summary: Returned space names will be expressed as a full pathname through the coordinate space tree.

remarks.para: Express space names as a full pathname through the coordinate space tree.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogSpaceTreePathnameConstants.Partial
member.summary: Returned space names will be expressed as a partial pathname through the coordinate space tree, starting at the space named by the first argument of the method that you called.

remarks.para: Express space names as a partial pathname through the coordinate space tree object, starting at the space specified by the first method argument.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogSpaceTreeDuplicateChildNameException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when you attempt to add a duplicate nonqualified coordinate space name to a single node in a or . All nonqualified space names that share the same parent node must be unique. For more information, see the topic titled 'Coordinate Space Names' in the online User's Guide.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogSpaceTreeFixturedSpaceNameCollisionException

or .
